citation.article-title: Dechloromonas agitata gen. nov., sp. nov. and Dechlorosoma suillum gen. nov., sp. nov., two novel environmentally dominant (per)chlorate-reducing bacteria and their phylogenetic position.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dechlorosoma suillum sp. nov.
Dechlorosoma suillum [su.il'lum; L. neut. adj. suillum pertaining to swine (Michaelidou et al., 2000))
Cells use acetate, propionate, butyrate, Casamino acids, lactate and ethanol as alternative electron donors with O2, (per)chlorate or nitrate as electron acceptor.
Nitrate is reduced to N2 gas.
Optimum growth is observed at 37 °C and pH 6.5 in freshwater medium (0% NaCl).
Type strain, PST, has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection under ATCC BAA-33T and in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH under DSM 13638T.
